item.title: Gambit Cyber Raises $3.4 Million in Seed Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The cybersecurity startup will use the funds to accelerate platform improvements, global expansion, and partnerships.

The post Gambit Cyber Raises $3.4 Million in Seed Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Ukrainian Nefilim Ransomware Affiliate Pleads Guilty in US
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Artem Stryzhak pleaded guilty to conspiracy to commit computer fraud after he was extradited earlier this year.

The post Ukrainian Nefilim Ransomware Affiliate Pleads Guilty in US appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: WatchGuard Patches Firebox Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The critical-severity bug in the Fireware OS’s iked process leads to unauthenticated remote code execution.

The post WatchGuard Patches Firebox Zero-Day Exploited in the Wild appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: UK Government Acknowledges It Is Investigating Cyber Incident After Media Reports
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The British government is investigating a “cyber incident” following news reports that hackers linked to China have gained access to thousands of confidential documents.

The post UK Government Acknowledges It Is Investigating Cyber Incident After Media Reports appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Thailand Conference Launches International Initiative to Fight Online Scams
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Similar pledges to fight scam networks were made by members of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations in the months leading up to the Bangkok conference.

The post Thailand Conference Launches International Initiative to Fight Online Scams appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Docker AI Attack, Google Sues Chinese Cybercriminals, Coupang Hacked by Employee
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Other noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Trump could use private firms for cyber offensive, China threat to US power grid, RaccoonO365 suspect arrested in Nigeria.

The post In Other News: Docker AI Attack, Google Sues Chinese Cybercriminals, Coupang Hacked by Employee appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks, Google Cloud Strike Multibillion-Dollar AI and Cloud Security Deal
item.dc:creator: Mike Lennon
item.description:
The agreement strengthens technical and commercial ties as Palo Alto migrates workloads and adopts Google’s Vertex AI and Gemini models.

The post Palo Alto Networks, Google Cloud Strike Multibillion-Dollar AI and Cloud Security Deal appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AI Security Firm Ciphero Emerges From Stealth With $2.5 Million in Funding
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The startup’s solution captures, verifies, and governs all AI interactions within an enterprise’s environment.

The post AI Security Firm Ciphero Emerges From Stealth With $2.5 Million in Funding appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Denmark Blames Russia for Cyberattacks Ahead of Elections and on Water Utility
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Danish intelligence service said the attacks were part of Russia’s “hybrid war” against the West and an attempt to create instability.

The post Denmark Blames Russia for Cyberattacks Ahead of Elections and on Water Utility appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chinese APT ‘LongNosedGoblin’ Targeting Asian Governments
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The hacking group has been using Group Policy to deploy cyberespionage tools on governmental networks.

The post Chinese APT ‘LongNosedGoblin’ Targeting Asian Governments appeared first on SecurityWeek.
